subject: Personal Finance
title: The Minimum Payment Trap
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Minimum Payment Trap.

hook.text: Your $3,000 credit card balance has a $60 minimum payment. You'll be paying for 15 years.

buildup.text: Minimum payments are usually 1-3% of the balance â€” barely covering interest.

discovery.text: On a $3,000 balance at 18%, minimum payments cost over $4,000 in interest alone.

twist.text: Banks set minimums low deliberately. The longer you pay, the more interest they earn.

climax.text: Paying even $20 above the minimum can cut repayment time in half. Small increases matter enormously.

punchline.text: The minimum keeps you in debt by design.

quiz.question: Why do banks set minimum payments so low?
options: To maximize the interest they collect over time
